2081.subject: SBS
2081.descrlong: Examines the social, cultural, economic, political, and religious underpinnings of the Maya dynastic tradition in comparative and cross-cultural terms and from the perspective of landmark archaeological projects and glyphic interpretations. Studies their respective significance in deciphering the larger Maya life. Uses virtual software-based glyphic translation and astronomical and calendrical correlation programs to probe the literary, artistic, and historical traditions of texts and monuments. Formerly known as SBSC 248.
